function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inadequate monitoring of indoor air quality parameters","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate monitoring of iaq parameters","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Higher concentration of vocs in buildings can lead to skin, throat, and respiratory irritation, as well as broader set of illnesses including headaches, fatigue, and respiratory symptoms.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mixture of pollutants in indoor air can generate secondary pollutants that are more harmful than the primary ones.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of biological agents in indoor air can degrade overall air quality and cause respiratory diseases and allergic sensitization.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of hazardous chemical pollutants such as vocs, co, and so2 in indoor environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ground-level ozone as a cause of respiratory health diseases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Health risks associated with high co2 concentration in indoor air","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Routine exposure to non-liquid petroleum gas fuel linked to acute infections in the lower respiratory tract, including pneumonia and severe pneumonia.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High concentration of pollutants such as particle matter in urban indoor environments, with a large proportion of ultra-fine particles.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Excessive exposure to solid fuel increasing the number of deaths among children in the age group of 1 to 4","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Solid fuel reported as the most significant reason behind many cases of non-fatal pneumonia","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced circulation of fresh air in buildings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased presence of vocs in indoor environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High percentage of time spent indoors","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of access to cleaner and efficient sources of fuel for cooking leading to health hazards","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor indoor environmental quality due to modern lifestyle choices","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Factors affecting indoor environment including air exchange, humidity, temperature, ventilation, pollutants","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor ventilation leading to reduced indoor air quality, causing health issues.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Excessive concentration of total suspended particles in poorly ventilated kitchens.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on biomass fuel leading to poor indoor air quality in households.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of harmful fuels for lighting","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Slow progress in the adoption of cleaner fuels","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Low global access to clean cooking","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Indoor air pollution due to biomass and coal smoke","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Premature deaths due to the use of coal and solid biomass for cooking","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient ventilation leading to loss of productivity","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of poor indoor climate on health and productivity","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High temperatures due to lack of ventilation leading to loss of productivity","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Cost-effectiveness of indoor climate on high-value work in the office","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in noise levels and communication speed in open-plan vs. closed offices","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conversion to open-plan offices may lead to a higher risk of contagious disease spread due to increased interaction and reduced physical barriers.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation systems in refurbishment alternatives leading to poor indoor air quality and high indoor temperatures.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Mechanical cooling of supply air to lower high temperatures may not effectively control the spread of contagious diseases in the built environment.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decreased ventilation rates in office rooms to provide ventilation to central meeting rooms may result in poor indoor air quality and increased risk of disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in the toilets may lead to poor indoor air quality and increased risk of disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Different office plans may impact the spread of contagious diseases due to varying spatial layouts and density of people.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation rates may lead to increased prevalence of respiratory diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High occupant density can contribute to the spread of respiratory diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High indoor temperatures causing a decrement in productivity","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of communicable respiratory diseases through airborne aerosols","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low ventilation rates leading to higher prevalence of respiratory diseases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate control of temperature leading to excessively high indoor temperatures","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dismantling of partition walls may disrupt the containment of contagious diseases and facilitate their spread within the building.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Workspace design may not consider physical distancing measures, leading to a higher risk of disease transmission among employees.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Refurbishment plans and changes in indoor climate may impact ventilation and air quality, potentially affecting disease transmission rates within the building.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Outdated hvac system with no cooling","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fixed utility rooms between corridors","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited use of open-plan office space","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor indoor climate leading to health issues","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
